snippet: The arrest of a former chief reporter for one of Rupert Murdoch’s tabloids raised the first allegations of witness tampering.
abstract: Scotland Yard arrests Neville Thurlbeck, a former chief reporter for The News of the World, on suspicion of intimidating a witness, the first time the police have raised the specter of witness tampering in the course of their investigations; it could prove to be one of the most damaging chapters yet in the scandal enveloping Rupert Murdoch’s tabloid newspapers in Britain.
lead_paragraph: The arrest of a former chief reporter for one of Rupert Murdoch’s tabloids raised the first allegations of witness tampering.

headline.seo: Witness Intimidation Cited in Hacking Scandal Arrest
headline.main: Witness Intimidation Cited in British Hacking Scandal
headline.print_headline: Witness Intimidation Alleged in Arrest in Hacking Scandal
